embeds.title: Fragmentation Grenade
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Gremlins / Downfall

Damage dealt to random enemies is increased by 3.
*Nobody dares to ask where the Gremlin got it from.*

messages.content: Itâ€™s damage
death pineapple my beloved
Does this affect <six point brand>?

embeds.title: Six-Point Brand
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Downfall

Whenever you play 6 cards, deal 6 damage to a random enemy.
*Fire, fire, fire, fire, fire, FIRE!*

messages.content: i vaguely remember it *should* affect all random target damage?
grems only has sneaky grems passive in that regard tho iirc
This makes sneaky's passive better
How much better?
Yes.

Somewhat difficult to get a lot out of this one. I don't believe there are very many sources of damage to random enemies for this to work with. Sure, you can use it with sneaky's passive to trigger an extra 3 damage on every attack, but that requires being able to keep sneaky in front, which is often difficult. Constant application of weak from fat gremlin is very valuable as a way to reduce incoming damage, building up wiz with wizard leads to explosive plays and huge burst damage, and shield gremlin can be used to help get enough block to counteract the low HP of gremlins generally. Even mad is really useful to leave in front at the end of your turn as a way to power up your multi-hit attacks/shivs for next turn. I think that sneaky probably has the worst passive bonus (barring act 1 where the extra damage is very relevant), so a relic that makes that a little better is very unexciting. I can't see almost any situation where I would buy this from a shop (maybe a very powerful sneaky lead deck with multiple copies of tricksy) and it's usually close to a dud if you get it randomly from a chest or elite.

this is obscenely good. Sneaky gremlin is already overpowered, having whats almost 3 strength for free; this DOUBLES that power. Its so strong that sometimes it can be worth pivoting your entire run to use sneaky gremlin if you find this early enough. in my experience most runs are using ether sneaky or wizard anyways and sneaky is the easiest gremlin to lean into; your already pretty likely to get use out of the grenade right away. In pretty normal gremlin runs its not uncommon for fragmentation grenade  to do 24+ damage for you per turn as a COMMON relic; busted (thats not even getting into some of the rare cards that can make stupid amounts of shivs per turn)
I would be very happy to receive fragmentation grenade as my rare relic; but the fact that this is a common makes this relic just insane

sure this relic has some runs where it is dead, but in the runs where you can use it (which is like 50-60%) its nuts and a common relic being dead inst the end of the world; we get stuff like the boot all the time.
This is very certainly a take I wasn't expecting
I've never seen two diametrically opposed takes in a row which were both argued that strongly

Personally I don't like sneaky that much, but outright doubling someone's passive for free is enough that I might pivot a run if I saw it in act 1. And wasn't trying to use wizard (since that pivot is basically starting over).

Yeah it kinda caught me off guard, I was not expecting such a sneaky fan to be out there. Sneaky has no defensive... anything. I'd consider it probably the 2nd or 3rd worst solo grem (a solo shield grem probably is worse, but in a party stick swap deck it's invaluable) with the only one it's guaranteed better than is mad.

Fat has really good defensive potential initially in early game and that can scale even higher while also gaining some offensive value too. And fat also has heckle. Aka unconditional collector's block call but better.
sneaky and fat decks do build highly similarly, since the focus is attack spam
imo earlygame you go sneaky/wiz bc you need the damage to hunt elites but wiz is more abusable
whereas sneaky is more stable but has less peak payoff

I'm assuming it's largely a playstyle difference that's causing such different opinions. I really value defensive reliability on gremlins (If you're going to lose a run with them, it's usually because of a death spiral/one you were leaning on dying), which makes me value fat and shield (and their relevant synergies) very highly. Gremlins get severly punished for not being able to block/mitigate damage consistently in a way no other character does in my experience.

For what it's worth, I do think sneaky is good, it's just that gremlins usually aren't hurting for burst damage in most runs, so I don't like leaning into it. It's a very strong leader in act 1 and early act 2, but it's very vulnerable to a death spiral if you can't pump out enough damage or start running into enemies like snake plant, writhing mass, and giant head (anything with very high hp really). I tend to try and build more well rounded decks, so getting more of something (burst damage) that a character is already good at isn't that appealing to me. I would guess that ahoodedman's playstyle tends to lean harder into that burst damage as a way to overpower most enemies. Sometimes the best defense is a good offense, and you don't necessarily need consistent block on gremlins if you can kill everything by turn 2. I just haven't had much success with that strategy personally.
even then typically such strats make a lot of use of <flurry> which you want to pop wiz for

Sneaky Gremlin's finisher is that card that gives you a shiv for every card played this turn. Mad can use it too (though Mad has other options). It's a bit unwieldy since it tends to overflow the hand if you're actually doing well.

embeds.title: Second Volley

Rare Attack / 2 :energy_gremlins: / The Gremlins / Downfall

Deal 6 damage. Gain a (an)  (**Upgrade**d) Shiv for each card played this turn.

messages.content: flurry only triggers sneaky's effect once, second volley does it up to 11 times in theory
and maybe 7 on a good day in practice
mad gremlin is the halfway point between sneaky and wizard so he can use both of their finishers mediocre-ly
mad just kinda stinky

He's never the MVP but I don't think mad is as bad as everyone says. Unless you're trying to do a lot of damage on turn 1, he almost always outperforms sneaky. And he makes a decent backup grem since he can do ok with basically everyone's cards except the ones that explicitly need wiz or weak stacks
granted in act 1 you do want to do a lot of damage on turn 1

also not that this is a big factor, but if you're playing mods with big act 4 fights like Pale of the Ancients or Ruina, mad is by far the easiest to do stupid scaling shenanigans with at that point in the game

second volley is one of the main reasons to build around sneaky, this card might as well read as
 "win the fight"

Its pretty normal to add shield gremlin cards into the deck later to survive act 4; although snecky gremlin can aggro through pretty much every fight in the game so you have a lot of time to make a block plan
I usually find that hand clogs on second volley only really matter in boss fights since if you have that many shivs you have overkilled every enemy already.

sneaky gremlin also unfortunately has a bad match up ageist neow; or at least it does prior to the revamp (which I have yet to play). Since thorns can really get in the way of shivs. To a greater extent then beat of death even since sneaky makes far more shivs then silent plus neow can stack the thorns up while having beat of life to drag out the fight. If it was not for act 4 I think sneaky would acutally be the strongest gremlin
